text: The COVID-19 pandemic was confirmed to have spread to Bangladesh in March 2020. ==Cases== The first three known cases were reported on 7 March 2020 by the country's epidemiology institute IEDCR. Infections remained low until the end of March but saw a large rise in April. 20-fold rise in Covid-19 cases in Bangladesh since April 1, Dhaka Tribune, 14 April 2020. In the week of 11 April, new cases in Bangladesh grew 1,155%, the highest in Asia, ahead of Indonesia with 186%. Mint Covid Tracker: Indiaâ€™s corona trajectory has tapered this week but still remains steeper than Asian peers, livemint, 11 April 2020. , there were a total of 18,863 confirmed cases besides 3,361 recovered & 283 deaths in the country of which 14 people had died in the last 24 hours. ==Criticisms== Experts criticised the lack of amount of tests performed in the country that has a population of over 160 million. Newspaper reports and social media continued to report about additional deaths of patients with COVID-19 symptoms. Some of the deceased were treated at COVID-19 isolation centres at hospitals in the districts and others were denied treatment, though no tests were given to confirm contagion. ==Response== On 22 March, Bangladesh declared a 10-day shut down effective from 26 March to 4 April. This was later increased to 5 May ==References== Category:2020s in Bangladesh Bangladesh
title: COVID-19 pandemic in Bangladesh
